comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Note how this pic is numbered 4514...whereas the other Peggy Petite pics are all numbered 4314...but I suspect this was a typo/mistake. Just going on some of the other Hall pics...eg. the pics of Vernon Sellars and Patsy Hill...it looks as if the Hall pics were numbered by photoshoot or by job...I wonder whether the numbering might also reflect the chronological sequence in which the pics were taken...the Sellars/Hill pics are numbered 4129...so although one of the Sellars/Hill pics turned up in the Advertiser in 1928, it's possible that the Sellars/Hill pics predate the Peggy Petite pics (which, given what we know of Peggy's sudden rise to stardom, were probably taken in 1927)...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Suggestion noted. So Vernon & Patsie appear in the newspapers in January 1928, Peggy Petite's portrait is April 1927. The number on Phyllis Baker's negative is 4134 and her image appears early - in March 1927. So the Hall numbers could be chronological. It's quite possible Vernon & Patsie had a history of performing together - the article mentioned they were both engaged on the 'Fuller Circuit'.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
